title: Tech Lead - Backend
content:
At Lyft, our mission is to improve people’s lives with the world’s best transportation. To do this, we start with our own community by creating an open, inclusive, and diverse organization.
Lyft is looking for experienced software engineers from a scope of disciplines. We are growing our team with people who want to build, improve and incorporate technologies that make the lives of our community more enriched. As an engineer at Lyft, you'll collaborate with teams like product, data science, analytics, and operations on code that empower us to iterate quickly, while focusing on delighting our passengers and drivers. 
Responsibilities:

Provide technical leadership and direction to the team, helping define the team’s roadmap, architecture, processes, and best practices
Write well-crafted, well-tested, readable, maintainable code. Leave the code in a better state than when you found it (progressive refactoring).
Perform thoughtful code reviews for colleagues to ensure code quality and distribute knowledge
Unblock, support and effectively communicate cross functionally in order to achieve results
Evangelize appropriate tech and engineering best practices, and occasionally give internal or external tech talks
Participate in hiring activities: take part in technical interviews, live coding, share detailed feedback to hiring best technical talent in the function
Act as a mentor to other developers on the team and across the company

Mandatory Skills

6+ years of software engineering industry experience
Experience with any backend programming language (e.g., Python, Golang, Java, C#, node.js)
Solid knowledge of algorithms, data structures, and object oriented programming
Strong experience with relational and/or non-relational databases
Ability to design and implement scalable and reliable software solutions
Passion for new technologies and performing research and development tasks
Ability to learn fast, collaborate cross-functionally and communicate effectively.
Write clear, scalable and clear design documentation

Nice to have

Familiarity with Flask
AWS experience (EC2, Redshift for data warehouse, Elastic MapReduce for data processing)
Experience in microservices architecture
Experience managing small engineering teams

This role will be in-office on a hybrid schedule if an established Lyft Location is available to the region — Team Members will be expected to work in the office 3 days per week on Mondays, Thursdays and a team-specific third day. Additionally, hybrid roles have the flexibility to work from anywhere for up to 4 weeks per year.

values.label: I am authorized to work for any employer in the country in which this position is based.
I require/will require Lyft's sponsorship to obtain work authorization in the country in which this position is based (e.g. H-1B, TN, etc.)
My status to work in the country in which this position is based is unknown.

questions.description: Lyft Candidate Privacy Policy (Mexico)
questions.label: Please review the linked document:

values.label: I acknowledge that I have read and understood the terms of the Lyft Candidate Privacy Notice.

questions.description: Lyft is committed to maintaining the same safe and inclusive environment for candidates as for our team members. Addressing you by the correct pronoun is an important part of this commitment.
questions.label: Please share your gender pronouns.
This position is required to work out of a Lyft Office in Mexico City, if you do not reside within the country and within a commutable proximity to the office, are you open to relocating?

values.label: I am willing to relocate before starting employment.
I am not willing to relocate before starting employment.
I already reside near a Lyft office and I am able to work at an On-site Office.

questions.label: Have you been employed by Lyft, or any subsidiary, affiliate, or business unit of Lyft, in the past (whether on a full-time or part-time basis)?
Do you have an advanced english level (writing, listening, speaking)?  *
Are you able to work in a hybrid model in CDMX, 3 days at office and 2 from home? *

values.label: Office: Yes, if Lyft opens in their city/state
Office: Not closed, but flexible attendance
Depends on the exact location in CDMX
